result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on January 11, 2023 at 08:00 am.

10:10 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Christopher Douglas Welsch in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Christopher Douglas Welsch.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF74 & 22CF185.  Court reviews file and notes off record discussions with attorneys. Atty Harrelson states DE is in custody and asks to schedule trial, no longer planning to continue to plea today. Court schedules trial and FPT dates. State requests to schedule both files for the JT.  Court confirms both will be scheduled as JT. Adjourned at 10:12 AM. bph

Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Christopher Douglas Welsch. Defendant Christopher Douglas Welsch in court, in custody. Includes 22CF74 & 22CF185. Court reviews file. 9:03 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Christopher Douglas Welsch appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF185 (set for PLEAS 6/16/22) & 22CF74 (set for PLEAS 6/17/22).  Court reviews file and notes scheduling error.  Court will take PLEAS off and schedule this matter out to allow time for Atty Harrelson to review discovery.  Adjourned at 9:08 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:02 AM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:   Erica Ellenwood w/Intern M. Connor Smith   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher Douglas Welsch appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  22CF74 and 22CF185. Atty Harrelson states that there is a likely resolution and asks to set a plea. Will set for trial if plea does not go.   Adjourned:  10:12 am. Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:45 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson via zoom, DF: Christopher Douglas Welsch appeared from jail. Includes 22CF74 & 22CF185.  Court reviews files and notes DE is on PO hold. Atty Harrelson states he has received an offer from the State, is in process of discussing offer with DE. Court will schedule another PTC to allow time for parties to look over agreement.  Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at 9:52 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Harrelson to appear via zoom for 05/18/22 Hearing. Per SRN, OK. JA cc'd Atty's. hml
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. km
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

03:00 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel  ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher Douglas Welsch appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: 22CF185 and 22CF74.  Court calls 22CF185:  S/T Deputy Dillon Olson, SCSO; direct by Atty Ellenwood.Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson.  Atty Ellenwood argues bindover, Atty Harrelson reserves. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. The State will not be filing any other charges on this case and Information will mirror the complaint.  Atty would like to proceed with ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Atty Harrelson states DE has been revoked on another matter and will be going to prison for 2 years, 8 mo.  Bond continues in form and amount on both matters. Adjourned:  3:13 pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc   e: DA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc
Filed by Erin M. arc
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Randall Vanderbeek (to the best of the jail's ability) .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court notes open case on 4/19 with Atty Harrelson representing.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
